New Records: Kiké Hernández now has 15 home runs in a postseason career, tying him with Babe Ruth for most postseason home runs
Key Match Events: Kiké Hernández delivered the biggest hit of the night to turn a two-run lead into a four-run cushion
Shohei Ohtani hit a mammoth home run in the eighth inning
Max Muncy went deep in the ninth to tie Corey Seager and Justin Turner for the most postseason home runs as a Dodger in franchise history
Pre-Game Insights: Kiké Hernández changed his Dodger Stadium walkup music to Bad Bunny’s “Mr. October” showing his readiness for the postseason
Post-Match Reflections: Kiké Hernández said he doesn't care if there was an inside-the-parker -- a homer is a homer
Mets reliever Reed Garrett said Hernández put a good swing on a bad pitch
Dodgers superstar Mookie Betts said Hernández is one of the players who can perform in certain moments
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Citi Field
Kiké Hernández now has a frequency of once every 13.3 at-bats in the postseason
He has 26.8 percent of his hits as home runs in the postseason
Others: The Dodgers' active leaders in postseason homers
Kiké Hernández is an unlikely member of this list of MLB’s active leaders in postseason homers
